meanings.definition: Covered with or full of bushes or shrubs
meanings.sent1: The forest path became boskiest as we ventured deeper into the woods.
meanings.sent2: The garden in spring looked boskiest with colorful flowers and lush greenery.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel got lost in the boskiest part of the park and couldn't find its way back.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was like the boskiest thicket, wild and untamed.
meanings.sent5: The jungle was so boskiest that even the sunlight struggled to penetrate through the dense foliage.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a dense growth of trees or shrubs
meanings.sent1: The ancient forest was known for its boskiest canopies that blocked out most of the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The national park was filled with boskiest areas where rare species of plants thrived.
meanings.sent3: The explorer felt like a tiny ant in the boskiest forest, surrounded by towering trees.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like the boskiest branches, intertwining and creating a complex network.
meanings.sent5: The valley was boskiest in the early morning, shrouded in mist and mystery.

meanings.definition: Characterized by an abundance of foliage or vegetation
meanings.sent1: The botanical garden was the boskiest place in town, filled with all kinds of plants.
meanings.sent2: The countryside in summer was at its boskiest, with fields of crops and wildflowers.
meanings.sent3: The picnic spot was so boskiest that they had to clear some bushes to set up their blanket.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was the boskiest garden, blooming with ideas and creativity.
meanings.sent5: The meadow was boskiest during the rainy season, turning into a sea of green.
